fields.description:
I would like to increase security by disabling http / https and forcing users to use SSH with pubkey authentication.
This is especially important, because users tend to put strings like https://username:password@host.tld/scm/project/repo.git in Bamboo or Jenkins with plaintexted password!
fields.summary: Add option to disable git clone over http / https

fields.description: As per the attached screen-shot, I'm comparing two git tags with stash. I should be able to tell if my developers have resolved the tickets from tag a to tag b without having to change context to jira. Stash should strikethrough the ticket if it's resolved or closed.
fields.summary: As a user I should be able to know if a jira ticket is resolved from within stash without having to change context

fields.description: Not able to add title to new ssh key but the label appear after create.
fields.summary: Project, when adding SSH key cant add title (label)

fields.description:
TypeScript is a widely used programming language, but Stash doesn't support TypeScript highlighting. Stash uses highlight.js for highlighting. I implemented TypeScript highlighting for it which is available in highlight.js 8.1, but apparently Stash has not updated to it yet.

---

Nowadays Stash uses highlight.js 7.3, which does not have Gherkin support.
It was going to be awesome if we could update it to at least version 8.1 which has such support
fields.summary: Update highlight.js to 8.0+

fields.description:
Currently in stash the description of Automatic Branch merging is the following:

"Enable automatic cascading merging from release branches to their downstream branches. To use this feature, the release branch type must be enabled or the production branch set."

Since we don't need release branches we tried to disable them since we only have a production branch and a development branch with hotfixes / feature branches.
But then stash also disables the automatic branch merging feature, even if the help text says that it should work with only a production branch and no release branches.
fields.summary: Automatic Merge needs release/ branch enabled.

fields.description:
Manual intervention required to change STASH_HOME when installing windows as a service. Stash will start as a clean installation otherwise.

Workaround: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASHKB/Change+STASH_HOME+when+installed+as+a+Windows+service
fields.summary: Upgrading Stash as a Windows service doesn't update the service correctly

fields.description:
Currently, a branch can' be deleted during a merge of a pull request if:

The branch is the default repository branch.
The user does not have permission to delete the branch.
The branch is subject to an open pull request.

I suggest adding an option do disable deletion of certain branches in a pull request merging in order to prevent accidental deletion of branches by people who have write permission on the branch.
fields.summary: Option to disable deletion of certain branches when merging pull requests

fields.description:
Currently, the checks for merging pull requests are defined on the repository level.

I suggest allowing to configure checks on the branch level.
While i want certain checks to be made when merging feature branches, i want other checks or no checks when merging other branches (from master to production for example).
fields.summary: Checks for merging pull requests  - per branch

fields.description:
Hi Team,

I am using stash trail version for my amazom m3.type account with one vCPU 	3.75 Mem (GiB) 	1X4 SSD Storage (GB). I have gone through the scalling URL https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Scaling+Stash , could not understand how much memory requires for say 50 or 100 users.

there is one document for confluence, which explain all the user and hardware requirements. https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Server+Hardware+Requirements+Guide

Is there any similar document for stash, if yes please let us know. we need that in for for production server.

please help us to find out the details for below info.

Max Concurrent Stash Users	Instance Size
‘n’ (users)	                                        M3.medium (3.75 GB RAM)
‘m’(users)	                                        M3.large (7.5 GB)
‘x’ (users)                                         M3.xlarge (15  GB).

Thank you
fields.summary: Hardware requirements
The task count not updated on the PR summary, even after the tasks list is open

fields.description:
It would be useful if feature/hotfix/bugfix branches were kept up to date through automated merge's by Stash.

For example, a feature branch is created from develop.  When a commit occurs to develop, the commit is auto merged to the feature branch.

Likewise, when a hotfix is created from master, any commits to master would be auto merged into the hotfix.

In our workflow, we also create bugfix branches from release branches in order to use the same pull request functionality back to the release branch.  This isn't specified in gitflow, but it would be useful for the same auto merging to occur (updating the bugfix branch when a commit occurs on the release branch).

This should probably be part of a setting for the auto merging system in Stash.

I am aware of similar functionality in Bamboo, but it is unreliable, doesn't seem to always trigger automatically, and slow.  The auto merging system in Stash is thus far fantastic and works brilliantly, creating pull requests when it can't merge automatically, instead of Bamboo just failing.
fields.summary: Auto update branches from the parent

fields.description:
On the web interface, submodule references show up in the file list (on the /browse pages), but they are completely passive objects. It would be very useful to be able to:
* view the history of the submodule reference, the same way as for files and
* jump to the referred commit in the submodule repository from here.
(I guess they could have a simple page like a one-line text file with all the usual options, plus a hyperlink that points to the target commit in the submodule repo.)
fields.summary: Make submodule references clickable on the web interface

fields.description:
When upgrading Stash (i.e. from 3.2 to 3.3) using the installer, the default "Stash" folder name is rejected. This shouldn't happen. See the screen below:
!StashInstallerError.png|thumbnail!

To get around this, you need to select a different folder name, which is not ideal to do every time you upgrade.
fields.summary: Error when selecting Stash on installer using Start menu folder screen during upgrade

fields.description:
Stash 3.3.0 with JIRA 6.2.5 as user directory server. JIRA is synced with MS AD LDAP.

While trying to login serveral users got error 500. With message about database error. Exception cast:

org.hibernate.NonUniqueResultException: query did not return a unique result: 2
	org.hibernate.internal.AbstractQueryImpl.uniqueElement(AbstractQueryImpl.java:975)

Full log in attachment.

Noticeable difference between users able to login and those wich are not:
affected users have a contact in AD under the same Base DN named with same CN.
fields.summary: Login error on MS AD user

fields.description: When I click in the search bar, I would expect it to behave just like it does in Confluence.  I would like to see a dropdown list of the 10 most recent repositories I have visited.  This makes sense because I'm probably going to be revisiting the same few repositories throughout the workday.
fields.summary: Clicking in search bar should show most recent projects

fields.description:
As specified in the document [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Automatic+branch+merging], Automatic Branch Merging demands the use of semantic versioning in branch names. The suggestion is to reinforce this in the UI when this option is configured and a branch is being created (so maybe when creating a new branch, the user would be advised about the semantic versioning and/or Stash would even stop the customer from creating a branch that not attend to this rule).

fields.description:
Crowd is querying {{cwd_user}} by {{external_id}} and is expecting unique results *for users*. There is no unique constraint on this column and in some conditions a crowd sync can cause duplicate {{external_id}} to be entered into the table.

Stack trace:
{noformat:title=atlassian-stash.log}
2015-05-13 02:37:56,086 ERROR [clusterScheduler_Worker-9]  c.a.c.d.DbCachingDirectoryPoller Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 32770 ].
org.hibernate.NonUniqueResultException: query did not return a unique result: 2
        at org.hibernate.internal.AbstractQueryImpl.uniqueElement(AbstractQueryImpl.java:975) ~[hibernate-core-4.3.8.Final.jar:4.3.8.Final]
        at org.hibernate.internal.CriteriaImpl.uniqueResult(CriteriaImpl.java:402) ~[hibernate-core-4.3.8.Final.jar:4.3.8.Final]
        at com.atlassian.crowd.dao.user.UserDAOHibernate.findByExternalId(UserDAOHibernate.java:211) ~[crowd-persistence-hibernate4-2.8.2-m5.jar:na]
        at com.atlassian.crowd.dao.user.UserDAOHibernate.findByExternalId(UserDAOHibernate.java:55) ~[crowd-persistence-hibernate4-2.8.2-m5.jar:na]
        ...
{noformat}



A fix should first check and remove duplicates that are orphaned from {{cwd_membership}}, then any remaining duplicate users, before creating the unique constraint.

h4. Workaround
This can be manually fixed by deleting duplicate entries. It appears that the bad entries are missing a corresponding entry in {{cwd_membership}}, but this may not be true for all cases.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASHKB/Unable+to+sync+crowd+user+directory+-+query+did+not+return+a+unique+result

h4. Fix
Stash 3.10 applies a new unique constraint to the relevant columns in the {{cwd_user}} table to ensure data consistency. If there are duplicate {{(directory_id, external_id)}} pairs when the system is upgraded to 3.10, they will be automatically repaired as part of upgrading.
This fix cannot be applied on SQL Server 2005. Due to limitations in SQL Server 2005, it is not possible to create a unique constraint or unique index on {{(directory_id, external_id)}} because external_id can be {{NULL}}. *As a result, support for SQL Server 2005 is now deprecated*. Stash will continue to run on SQL Server 2005, but this constraint will not be applied. As a result, it's possible instances running against SQL Server 2005 may continue to fail. Support for SQL Server 2005 will be fully removed in Stash 4.0. Administrators with Stash instances using SQL Server 2005 will be required to either update their SQL Server to 2008 or newer, or migrate to another supported database. Any instance still running on SQL Server 2005 will be unable to start after upgrading to 4.0.
After upgrading to 3.10, the exact failure described here is no longer possible. However, it may be possible for LDAP synchronization to fail if the new constraint is violated. Anyone whose instance encounters such a failure is encouraged to open a support request and provide details on the error. (This failure is very unlikely, but I want to note it here in case it does happen.)
fields.summary: Unique key constraints not working for Embedded Crowd table cwd_user

fields.description:
During work many of us have multiple browser tabs for working in Stash.  This is usually due to the fact multiple pull requests being viewed at a time by certain people.  Sometimes one of us will go idle past the timeout period and get logged out.

The problem occurs when they go to one of those tabs, trigger the prompt to log back in, (get logged in again).  If another one of those tabs is touched (other than the one that just logged back in) then it will log you out in all of the tabs (even the one you just logged back in from!).

The only workaround we've found is to close all tabs except the one that was prompted to log back in as touching any other tab will trigger the issue.
fields.summary: Using multiple browser tabs for Stash will log you out after logging back in

fields.description:
We have mirror of https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src in our Stash. With all heads and tags. Entire mirror, updated continuesly.

Today this repo start throws errors on git clone, like this:
{code}
aefimov@aefimov-macbook:~/projects/sandbox $ git clone https://stash.acme.com/scm/chromium/src.git
Cloning into 'src'...
remote: Counting objects: 3125562, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (542218/542218), done.
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly 1.00 GiB | 11.05 MiB/s
fatal: early EOF
fatal: index-pack failed
{code}

Or like this (it's random, i guess):
{code}
aefimov@aefimov-macbook:~/projects/sandbox $ git clone https://stash.acme.com/scm/chromium/src.git
Cloning into 'src'...
remote: Counting objects: 3125562, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (542218/542218), done.
fatal: protocol error: bad line length character: Q�r 11.13 MiB/s
error: inflate: data stream error (invalid distance too far back)
fatal: pack has bad object at offset 1100761893: inflate returned -3
fatal: index-pack failed
{code}

Why this happened. We used nginx as reverse proxy. Then we try to clone directly from java, all works fine:
{code}
aefimov@aefimov-macbook:~/projects/sandbox $ git clone http://stash.acme.com:7990/scm/chromium/src.git
Cloning into 'src'...
remote: Counting objects: 3125562, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (542218/542218), done.
remote: Total 3125562 (delta 2544811), reused 3092910 (delta 2512475)
Receiving objects: 100% (3125562/3125562), 2.19 GiB | 11.12 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (2544811/2544811), done.
Checking connectivity... done.
Checking out files: 100% (66640/66640), done.
{code}

The nginx server have temporary buffer on disk, where it server response. In some large repos, this buffer is overflowed and shrinked by default capacity. As result you see wrong packets in Git clone error message.

To avoid this we make such commit in or nginx:
https://bitbucket.org/lelik/atlassian-stash-deb/commits/b958979dfbaebeaa385af3a92a3df5081f4f410e?at=master

Maybe this capacity overflow forced by upgrading to Stash 3.3.0, maybe updates into with repo from Google with big files.

So, will be nice to have check, that you does not change Smart Git protocol in 3.3 release (i see no changes in code around Git Protocol exactly), or have a docs to avoid this problem on customers side -- simple define minimum buffer capacity for nginx reverse proxy depending on you Smart HTTP implementation (10gb in our case has solved problem).

We used git 2.1.0 on server and client too.
After changing nginx config:
{code}
aefimov@aefimov-macbook:~/projects/sandbox $ rm -rf src/ && git clone https://stash.acme.com/scm/chromium/src.git
Cloning into 'src'...
remote: Counting objects: 3125732, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (518254/518254), done.
remote: Total 3125732 (delta 2543666), reused 3118527 (delta 2536589)
Receiving objects: 100% (3125732/3125732), 2.20 GiB | 11.13 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (2543666/2543666), done.
Checking connectivity... done.
Checking out files: 100% (66651/66651), done.
{code}
fields.summary: Nginx as frontend to Stash can break Git clone

{panel:title=Atlassian status as of March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

I'm excited to share that in Bitbucket Server 7.0 we shipped redesigned and optimized pull request page with several improvements you’ve been asking us for a long time. One of the improvements is the new tasks, which can now be created without parent comment.

Please, don't hesitate to leave feedback on the feature in the comments below. We would like to know if new tasks solve your problems. 

You can find more information in the Bitbucket Server 7.0 [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-7-0-release-notes-990546638.html] and Pull Requests [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/review-and-discuss-a-pull-request-808488540.html].

Anton Genkin
 Product Manager Bitbucket Server
{panel}
*Original description*
 My team loves the new tasks; they certainly make the review process much nicer!

It would be really great if you could create task items directly on the diffs without having to create a comment first. Sometimes the task is large enough to need a comment, and then break it out in to tasks. Other times it's a simple task like "Add javadocs".

There are a couple of other possibilities for this:
 * Asking for changes to files that haven't been modified yet (example: "Add missing changes to ThisOtherService.java")
 * Grouping together changes for multiple files (example: "Clean up the changes in the com.example.controllers package")
fields.summary: Allow the creation of tasks without requiring a comment

{panel}

This issue was reported by one of [SVN Mirror Add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.tmatesoft.subgit.stash-svn-importer] users.

When Git-SVN mirror is enabled for a Git repository, automatic branch merging is basically disabled for those branches synchronized with SVN server.

When Stash automatically merges one branch into another, it triggers no hooks, so our plugin is not able to process created merge commit. Next time the plugin synchronizes Git repository with SVN server, it has to revert merge commit since there is no corresponding revision on SVN side.

This is a rule of thumb for our plugin to operate normally: any change to Git repository should trigger pre-receive hook or any other hook with similar semantics (this hook should be able to reject incoming change). A good example of such hook is GitPullRequestMergeRequestedEvent that allows rejecting any attempt to merge pull request.

Regards,
Semyon
fields.summary: Ability to veto automatic branch merging

fields.description:
{quote}We are currently evaluating Stash for our Git review and management tools as standard within our organization.
We have a requirement where we should only allow users from a LDAP group. Adding single users either from LDAP group or local stash should be prevented. Meaning all the users should come from a LDAP group.
Intention:
If project admin is allowed to change/add user & permissions for a project or to its own repositories, we do not control over users being used and we can not control the licenses. Our intention is to control the no of users at LDAP group and not at stash.
Somehow we want to hide/disable the "User access" tab in a permissions page, we only need "Group access" tab. We only need to either add LDAP group or remove in the project/repository permission configuration page. Adding a user should be only done at LDAP group and not at stash itself.
E.g.
A read/write permission to a stash project or repository must be granted an access to any user via LDAP group and not manually by project admin.{quote}
fields.summary: Option to disable User Access Permission

fields.description:
When creating a Pull Request off a forked repo residing in your profile, it defaults to upstream Project.

*Steps:*
1- Create a repo
2- Fork into your profile
3- Browse to your profile. Create a Pull Request off the forked repo.
4- Notice that it will default to master in the upstream project off where it's been forked

!Pull_Request_Personal_Fork.png|thumbnail!


However, if you create a Pull Request off a forked repo residing in a project, it defaults to master within that Project/Repo. It should also default to the upstream.

*Steps:*
1- Create a repo
2- Fork into a Project in your instance
3- Browse to the fork within the repo above. Create a Pull Request off the forked repo
4- Notice that it will default to master within the fork

!Pull_Request_Project_Fork.png|thumbnail!

Pull Requests created on from forks should have a consistent behaviour.
fields.summary: Pull Requests created off project forks should follow the same rule as private forks for consistency

Just like JIRA has "schemes", I'd like to be able to apply a group of settings to a repository.

For example, we have about 250 repositories and only about 3 different workflows.  Each workflow involves settings ranging from branch permissions to the settings for a number of plugins.  In total we need to configure about 20 settings across various different pages.  So if we take 5 seconds per setting then it takes 7hrs of configuration effort to set up the repositories.  Then if we discover an enhanced workflow we have to open up all the repositories in tabs again to do it over again.

I would suggest having a way to have a setting profile that you can select per repository.  For ease of dealing with custom repository settings it could be such that if you have a profile selected it uses it and disables repo settings, otherwise you can ignore the central profile and configure the repository yourself.  Alternatives there include more selective overrides at the repo level.

This same thought about global configuration profiles applies to projects as well, but the biggest pain point is repos since they have the majority of the settings and they are nested.  We have even been building an internal tool to attempt to deal with this problem ourselves, but my dev indicates that some settings (such as for the Workzone plugin) don't seem accessible via REST (not confirmed).
fields.summary: Ability to configure repositories in groups

fields.description:
When creating a Pull Request, the description of it is automatically filled out based off the commits linked to it.

However, long commits are truncated and users have to manually fix that. It would be great not to truncate the commits/.
fields.summary: Don't truncate commit message when generating pull request description

fields.description: When deleting a large number of users in rapid succession via REST the license count can end up frozen and is no longer updated by any action. The only way to reset the license count is to restart Stash.
fields.summary: Deleting users in parallel makes the license count go stale

fields.description: Because the .md file renderer doesn't show source, the blame button does nothing. We need to disable it when viewing non-text representations of a file.
fields.summary: Blame button does nothing when viewing a markdown .md file in source view and should be removed

fields.description: For now, Stash does not have the capability to migrate or import users from one directory to another. It would be great if Stash has the same capability as [JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+Users+between+User+Directories] for this.
fields.summary: Add ability to Migrate Users from one directory to another

fields.description:
Pull requests cannot be deleted.   This cascades into branch deletion.  Branches cannot be deleted with outstanding pull requests.   The user who creates a branch MUST be able to delete it, regardless of its state.  (% git branch -D ...)

This is a problem since, invariably, the reviewers asked to approve/merge the pull requests are not the same as the author(s) who created the pull request.  

This can easily lead to workflow mistakes where invalid pull requests are accepted and merged into the company src code.  This limitation prevents the author of the pull request from being able to remedy the situation directly, without reviewers assistance.

Further, this can lead to excessive buildup of cruft within the git tree - hundreds of useless branches that cannot be deleted.   This can be confusing to all users.

So either a bug fix to delete a branch, regardless of its state, or a bug fix to delete (by author) pull requests must be added.
fields.summary: Pull requests cannot be deleted

fields.description:
We use stash for develop Unity3D application. It generated many .meta file which include to branch.
Also our painter want to see only graphics file but not code.
fields.summary: File filter for code review process
Home/End/PageUp/PageDown don't work in Pull request

fields.description: Notify the particular reviewer when he/she is removed from a PR.
fields.summary: Send Notification when PR reviewer is removed

fields.description:
When you merge a Pull Reuqest and decide to delete the source branch, all links containing a reference to this branch (Files, Branches, Commits...) will become dead. This won't change even if you open the settings of the repository. 

You do have to rebrowse the repository from projects/repository or from the history.
fields.summary: After deleting a Branch via Pull Request merge, all links containing a branch are dead

fields.description:
Hi,

I have added SSH keys to a repository and then was trying to add globally to my account via 'Manage account' then 'SSH Keys'. I got an error message that the same key has been already used on one of repositories. There is no information/hints which repositories the same key has been used on. Now, it took me about 15 minutes (JIRA is quite slow despite stack it's hosted on eg. 2GB RAM 1 CORE) to track a repo with my key. I only have about 10 repos so now imagine if you had hundreds or thousands of repos - it could take hours or days!!

I suggest you list all repos (linked to SSH keys section would be even better) keys have been used so people could go straight to them and remove instead of having to guess or search through all. Alternatively, SSH keys added on user account level should automatically remove from repositories and use new one instead. An appropriate warning message should be displayed about risks associated with this action.

Kind regards,
David
fields.summary: User account SSH keys rejected and difficult to find to remove in other repositories

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a feature like GitHub's [Contributing Guidelines|https://github.com/blog/1184-contributing-guidelines] in Stash. We would like to use it so the team rules can be displayed when creating and reviewing pull requests. I think the convention of using a {{CONTRIBUTING.md}} file is good.

It would definitely be useful to have the whole contents of the file displayed on the create pull request page. Perhaps it could be reduced to a banner (like GitHub) on the review pull request page but with the ability to expand the banner to display the contents of the markdown file on the page when clicked.
fields.summary: Add contributing guidelines to pull request pages

fields.description:
I've just experienced some weirdness with the Stash PR view.  Steps to reproduce:

1. Open a PR, click on a file in the file tree. Let's call this {{file1}}.
2. Search for some text, wait for search results
3. Click on a file in the search results in the file tree. This should be a different file than the one you were originally on. You are now looking at {{file2}}.
3. Now clear the search results.

Expected behaviour:
* {{file2}} continues to be shown on the right.
* {{file2}} becomes the highlighted file in the tree

Actual behaviour:
* {{file2}} continues to be shown on the right.
* {{file1}} is highlighted in the tree (!)
* Clicking on {{file1}} in the file tree has no effect--{{file2}} remains the displayed file.
fields.summary: Focus does not follow selected file, or vice versa

fields.description:
First tab index from comment field is "preview" not submit.

This is annoying.
fields.summary: First tab index from comment field is "preview" not submit

fields.description:
Cancelling backups in the stash UI doesn't work. To reproduce:

1 Using the backup client (v.1.3.1), start a backup
1 Go to the UI, and get the maintenance page (http://localhost:7990/stash/unavailable)
1 Provide the token from the logs
1 Click 'cancel backup', and accept the confirmation prompt

Expected results: Backup is cancelled

Actual results: Tomcat error message "HTTP Status 405 - HTTP method POST is not supported by this URL"
fields.summary: Can't cancel backups through web interface

fields.description:
Stash reports "Unauthorized token" when a valid token is used if the Hipchat Server URL set in _Server Settings_ has a trailing forward slash. Example {{https://hipchat.example.com/}}

The token works fine when the forward slash is removed. Example {{https://hipchat.example.com}}
fields.summary: Hipchat token unauthorized if hipchat server url has a trailing forward slash

fields.description:
If you have issue summary in Jira in Russian (or any non latin symbols) you will not have correct branch name in STASH.

If you try to create branch from lira you come to page:
https://stash.example.com/plugins/servlet/create-branch?issueKey=XXX-598&issueType=New+Feature&issueSummary=Сайт+в+IE7+не+открывается

As you can see we have: 
issueSummary=Сайт+в+IE7+не+открывается

And we will get branch name as:
XXX-598-ie7
So all not latin symbols removed. 

Expected result (example of transit on site: translit.net):
XXX-598-sajt-v-ie7-ne-otkryvaetsja

Can you please add transliteration feature?

Thank you.
fields.summary: Create branch from Jira — transliterate non-latin characters

fields.description:
I have created a new branch with a german umlaut ('ü') over our IDE (PHPStorm).
Push as new remote branch was successfull.
The new branch is listed in branchlist inside stash and it is possible to select this branch.
With this branch selected I can not list the files in this branch inside stash.
An error was shown that a branch with this name does not exists.
When I use 'delete' from the action menue for this branch, the branch will disappear from the list, but after reload the branch is listed again.
An Error was not shown.
fields.summary: Branchname with german umlaut

fields.description:
When there are conflicting changes in other branches (i.e. master) Stash stops you from pressing the "merge" button. The (!) next to the merge button tells you what command are required to resolve the conflicts before merging.
After you follow the instructions, you can see the merge commit (after switching tabs between 'dff' and 'commits'.
The merge button is inoperable and the (!) is still present next to it.  
Only after refreshing the whole page the button is enabled and the (!) is removed. 
Version: v3.3.0-m14
fields.summary: Stops you merging even after conflicts are resolved

fields.description:
The History dropdown for individual files is unusable when there are a large number of revisions for a given file.

I would prefer the History for a file to be a full HTML page of its own, consisting of a list of the file revisions for the file. Links for each entry in the file history page would allow me to:

* Navigate to the commit and see the full diff for that commit.
* Navigate to the diff of that file from the previous commit of that file.
* Browse the source tree for that commit.

GitHub's history page is a good example of this done right:
https://github.com/wooster/biplist/commits/master/biplist/__init__.py

As is BitBucket's:
https://bitbucket.org/wooster/biplist/history-node/1ba3f002a982/biplist/__init__.py?at=master
fields.summary: File History Page, rather than Dropdown

fields.description:
Stash is very light and fast.  But we find that it's lacking some much needed code review features that we see on others.  The main features we are looking for are 'enable code review status transition'  and 'be able to see diff between two incremental commits'.

Currently the only way to communicate with change owner is by leaving comments in pull request.  This update can be buried in the huge volume of email Stash sent out on all the activities.  By adding a "Done reviewing" button, for example, which in turn move the code review to a new state, will allow change owner to add more accurate email filter to get notified on the status change right away.  This will free user from checking the pull request frequently to find out the updates.

Crucible allow user to see the incremental change between any number of commits for a code review.  We would like to see the same feature in Stash as well.
fields.summary: Enterprise code review capability in Stash

fields.description:
When I restart the stash server, the service is started as root.

Using init.d script:

{code}
#! /bin/sh

### BEGIN INIT INFO
# Provides:          stash
# Required-Start:    $remote_fs $syslog
# Required-Stop:     $remote_fs $syslog
# Default-Start:     2 3 4 5
# Default-Stop:      0 1 6
# Short-Description: Initscript for Atlassian Stash
# Description:  Automatically start Atlassian Stash when the system starts up.
#               Provide commands for manually starting and stopping Stash.
### END INIT INFO

# Adapt the following lines to your configuration
# RUNUSER: The user to run Stash as.
RUNUSER=stash

# STASH_INSTALLDIR: The path to the Stash installation directory
STASH_INSTALLDIR="/opt/atlassian-stash-latest"

# STASH_HOME: Path to the Stash home directory
STASH_HOME="/git/stash-home"

# =============================================================================$
# =============================================================================$
# =============================================================================$

# PATH should only include /usr/* if it runs after the mountnfs.sh script
PATH=/sbin:/usr/sbin:/bin:/usr/bin
DESC="Atlassian Stash"
NAME=stash
PIDFILE=$STASH_INSTALLDIR/work/catalina.pid
SCRIPTNAME=/etc/init.d/$NAME

# Read configuration variable file if it is present
[ -r /etc/default/$NAME ] && . /etc/default/$NAME

# Define LSB log_* functions.

# To be replaced by LSB functions
# Defined here for distributions that don't define
# log_daemon_msg
log_daemon_msg () {
    echo $@
}

# To be replaced by LSB functions
# Defined here for distributions that don't define
# log_end_msg
log_end_msg () {
    retval=$1
    if [ $retval -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "."
    else
        echo " failed!"
    fi
    return $retval
}

# Depend on lsb-base (>= 3.0-6) to ensure that this file is present.
. /lib/lsb/init-functions


run_with_home() {
    if [ "$RUNUSER" != "$USER" ]; then
        su - "$RUNUSER" -c "export STASH_HOME=${STASH_HOME};${STASH_INSTALLDIR}$
    else
        export STASH_HOME=${STASH_HOME};${STASH_INSTALLDIR}/bin/$1
    fi
}

#
# Function that starts the daemon/service
#
do_start()
{
    run_with_home start-stash.sh
}

#
# Function that stops the daemon/service
#
do_stop()
{
    if [ -e $PIDFILE ]; then
      run_with_home stop-stash.sh
    else
      log_failure_msg "$NAME is not running."
    fi
}


case "$1" in
  start)
    [ "$VERBOSE" != no ] && log_daemon_msg "Starting $DESC" "$NAME"
    do_start
    case "$?" in
        0|1) [ "$VERBOSE" != no ] && log_end_msg 0 ;;
        2) [ "$VERBOSE" != no ] && log_end_msg 1 ;;
    esac
    ;;
  stop)
    [ "$VERBOSE" != no ] && log_daemon_msg "Stopping $DESC" "$NAME"
    do_stop
    case "$?" in
        0|1) [ "$VERBOSE" != no ] && log_end_msg 0 ;;
        2) [ "$VERBOSE" != no ] && log_end_msg 1 ;;
    esac
    ;;
  status)
       if [ ! -e $PIDFILE ]; then
         log_failure_msg "$NAME is not running."
         return 1
       fi
       status_of_proc -p $PIDFILE "" $NAME && exit 0 || exit $?
       ;;
  restart|force-reload)
    #
    # If the "reload" option is implemented then remove the
    # 'force-reload' alias
    #
    log_daemon_msg "Restarting $DESC" "$NAME"
    do_stop
    case "$?" in
      0|1)
        do_start
        case "$?" in
            0) log_end_msg 0 ;;
            1) log_end_msg 1 ;; # Old process is still running
            *) log_end_msg 1 ;; # Failed to start
        esac
        ;;
      *)
        # Failed to stop
        log_end_msg 1
        ;;
    esac
    ;;
  *)
    echo "Usage: $SCRIPTNAME {start|stop|status|restart|force-reload}" >&2
    exit 3
    ;;
esac

{code}
fields.summary: stash service is starting as root

fields.description:
Before the addition of local avatars getting a Stash users avatar was simply an MD5 on their email and an img src ref to gravatar.  Currently there appears to be no rest api to determine if an account has a local avatar, or a method to retrieve the local image (although there are post and delete operations for the avatars).

  The user slug should describe what avatar type is in use for the user. 

There should be a way to reference a local avatar image.

For convenience it would be great if the API simply gave me the src value for the image tag, and hid the choice of local/gravatar from me.  This would make any other cleanup of the multiple avatars across the Atlassian product line smoother for developers.




An example existing use case:
https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlasboard-atlassian-package/src/732913634072152e771c52ec822bfee06bb0eee2/widgets/pending-PR/pending-PR.js?at=master#cl-86
fields.summary: Document how to include avatars on REST requests

!stash.serverSettings.sshPort.png|thumbnail!
Please, notice the port number 22 is in use, instead of 7999 as described in the "{{SSH port}}" required field.
{code}
(com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException : java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.stash.repository.StashRepositoryException: com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException: com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.GitCommandException: command /usr/bin/git ls-remote ssh://22bc3160-b4f8-4024-bf38-48cc6b1b2e78@127.0.0.1:56335/sup/repository.git failed with code 128. Working directory was [.]., stderr: Authenticating remote session failed stdout: [Warning: Permanently added '[127.0.0.1]:56335' (RSA) to the list of known hosts., BAMBOO-SSH-PROXY: [While connecting to [git@stash-baseURL/127.0.0.1:22]: Authenticating remote session failed], fatal: Could not read from remote repository., , Please make sure you have the correct access rights, and the repository exists.])
{code}

When I'm creating a pull request, the diff sometimes shows things that do not differ.
In the diff after the pull request is made, it shows correct.
I think it has something to do with viewing commit diff and not what actually differs from the two branches.

Details like:
- Directory
- Last Login
- Last Failed Login
- Login Count

Can be very useful when troubleshooting for users claiming not to have access to Stash.

It would be good to have this info available just as it is in JIRA.

!jira_user_details_screen_shot.png!

fields.description:
It should be possible to install a new instance of Bitbucket Server without manually going through the setup process.

An option would be to provide a properties file that contains the admin user information, user directories configuration (e.g. LDAP, Crowd or JIRA), database and the license information so that the setup process happen automatically.

Together with BSERV-3089 it should be possible to:

* Treat the downloaded artifact as being immutable with all the necessary changes defined outside of the installation directory
* Download Bitbucket Server and set it up using configuration management tools (e.g. Puppet, Chef, Salt, Ansible) that don't require a human to go through the setup process


h3. Notes
The *database* can be defined as described in [the comment below|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-5167?focusedCommentId=1050346&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1050346]
fields.summary: Enable unguided/automated installation

fields.description:
I found some plugins that validate commits and enforce the dev to use a JiraID for all of them, but in our case, we only need that at the pull request level.
So is there an easy was to force devs to specify a Jira ID in the pull request, or do I have to write my own plugin for that ? (a merge-check maybe ?)
fields.summary: Pull request title require JIRA issue key.

fields.description:
Until Stash 3.0.4 the reviewers in Pull requests list were sort by approval status.
Since 3.2.x versions there is no logical order for the reviewers, so every time a user refresh the window the reviewers order changes and the user needs to check manually who approved the pull request.
Please check the attached screenshot to see that the reviewers are not sorted by any criteria.
fields.summary: Order the pull requests users by approval status.

fields.description:
Currently, as per STASH-3873, if a file is moved in a pull request, then the pull request will display the new file, in addition to a little button that shows where it was moved from on hover. It would be nice for our organization if we could also see the source file in the pull request with the location it was moved _to_. This would be to emphasize that the file at that location no longer exists.

The example use case would be if some evil malicious person slipped in some code as {{hosts.deny}} renamed to {{README.txt}}. If someone doesn't happen to hover over the {{moved}} (for example thinking that "Maybe someone renamed {{README}} to {{README.txt}}", or just skips over the file entirely cause "Well, it's a readme, whatever". This is granted things that should be checked during a code review but... you know... people are people.
fields.summary: Show source files of moves in pull request
RepositoryPushEvent is not getting all RefChanges
Backup client places stash-config.properties in STASH_HOME not STASH_SHARED_HOME for Stash 3.2+

fields.description:
While working on two features A and B it may happen that work on feature B to go incrementally or to be dependent of work on feature A.

We have to branches, A and B initiated from a common development branch, let's say it is master in this case.
Ar some point in time, while working on branch B we realize that the work done on branch A is useful and merge branch A in branch B, knowing that A will be ready and merged in master before B will.

Code reviewing feature A works great. You have the source A, the destination master.
When reviewing work on branch B, the destination is again master but the Diff tab will show all the difference both branches A and B introduces against master.
We need to review only new changes in B.

When creating/editing a review we need a box to select other reviews that should be dependent on.
While considering commits to review it is all commits in branch B and not in master or branch A.
To show the diff it should be the diff introduced by the merge of branch B in master, after branch A is already merged.
fields.summary: Dependent pull requests

fields.description:
More precisely Stash sends to the backup client the system.zip database backup with only a placeholder stash-config.properties in it. This is because ConfigurationBackupStep still looks for stash-config.properties in STASH_HOME not STASH_SHARED_HOME.

If a customer encounters this bug their original stash-config.properties file will still be available in the backup tar, it's just that it won't be restored (because it's the one from the system.zip file in the backup tar that is restored).
fields.summary: Contents of stash-config.properties not restored by the backup client
Edited comments show the month in lowercase
